Implements your monitor plugins in Java by using
Java Nagios Remote Plugin Executor

Get Started with JNRPE 2.1.0

Download - Release Notes - Apache v2 license

Works on:

Easy to use and extend

Runs everywhere

Easy to install and run thank to the GUI installer, it runs on any system supporting JAVA without need to recompile JNRPE or its plugins

How to install JNRPE?

Easy to extend

Adding a plugin can be as simple as implementing an interface and writing an XML file
 

How to create new plugins?

Compatible

You can replace NRPE with JNRPE: it fully supports the NRPE protocol. Moreover, it can run native plugins, giving it the ability to run legacy Nagios plugins

How to run JNRPE?
A huge list of checks can be done by using JNRPE
Through the usage of the EXEC plugin, you have access more than 4000 Nagios plugins
check_oracle

Check if DB is alive,
tablespace usage, cache usage

check_pgsql

Check if DB is alive

check_pgsql

Check if DB is alive
and slave status

check_mysql_query

Checks a custom query result

check_disk

Checks disk space

check_procs

Checks system processes

check_users

Checks the number of
connected users

check_file

Checks that a file exists
or contains a given string

check_ssh

Checks the ssh server status

check_by_ssh

Checks the output of a command
remotely executed through ssh

check_http

Checks the status of a given
HTTP server

check_ping

Checks connection statistics
for a remote host

check_time

Checks the clock on a
specified host.

check_jmx

Check the result of a
specified jmx query

check_tomcat

Checks memory and thread
usage of a specified tomcat instance

exec

Allows the execution of
a legacy native plugin
